bibl.title: Current Trends in the Study of Hellenic Myth in Early Third-Century Alexandrian Poetry: The Case of Theocritus.
bibl.note: Greek poetry is likely to fall in line with the Ptolemies' programme as it is observable in their shaping of royal cult-practice and of the ways in which they wanted to be portrayed in fine art. Greek poetry will have been kept chauvinistically Greek.
Zanker Graham, Current Trends in the Study of Hellenic Myth in Early Third-Century Alexandrian Poetry: The Case of Theocritus.
